Reviews.Title: “First Class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolb1990
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in April. Delighted with this quality character hotel. Everything immacutely clean , attention to detail excellent , slippers and chocs by the bed every evening. On B&B only, the breakfasts were good with plenty choice. Within walking distance of all attractions, and good restaurants nearby. Gino,s 5mins away, we found this restaurant to be one of the best at a reasonable price, and full of locals. Drinks in hotel expensive, but not a problem with so many bars close by. All staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but lovely”
Reviews.Author: myless
Reviews.Content: The drinks are a rip off but the rooms are nice, good size for Rome. I loved the courtyard and the atmosphere in the place. Its very easy to walk from here to the Vatican and most of the major tourist attractions, has a lots of restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Ðefinitely a place I'd go back to, not your typical hotel chain building.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in wonderful part of town”
Reviews.Author: Ken F
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome on business for 3 nights in December of 2011, and stayed here because of the recommendation of a work colleague. The staff was warm and helpful, and my room was comfortable, clean, and large enough for me. The Hotel is in a great part of town with lots of choices for small restaurants and cafes withing walking distance. Its easy to walk across the river to central Rome, or better yet, explore Trastevre. Yes, there is no WiFi in the room, but you can access it for free in the common area of the Hotel where breakfast is served. You're in Rome! Get off the Internet and out of your room and walk the City. The Hotel had a nice garden area which I think might also have WiFi coverage, but it was a bit too cold to sit out there in December. I hope to get back to Rome in the Fall, and will stay here again if I do.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this convent turned hotel with fabulous view”
Reviews.Author: valuewise1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 6 nights. First night the room was warm for our taste til we figured out to shut off the heat and open the windows. No problem with mosquitos in March, but the noise took some getting used to from the busy street. Once we adjusted, we slept well. The surroundings in the courtyard and rooftop are excellent. The paintings and architecture are incomparable! The room was immaculate and cleaned sometimes twice a day. The front desk was very helpful in recommending restaurants, artisan gelato (fig gelato mmmm good!) and arranging a taxi when needed. Right in the heart of the restaurant area, Trastevere. Bus stop 10 minutes away, restaurants right outside the door. A bit far from the sites after a long day of touring, but the taxi ride wasn't steep and if you have energy you can hoof it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mhellems
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Loved this place from the moment we arrived. The service at the front desk was excellent from the beginning to the end of our visit. Our room was not only spacious but also beautiful. The breakfast was fantastic with such a variety of selections to please your appetite. This hotel is located in a wonderful area of Trastevere, it was is convienent to walk out of the hotel and shop and dine in this unique area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel tucked away in a quiet corner of Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsScout
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with very friendly staff. Great location. Breakfasts were memorable. Totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “No champagne glasses on new years eve or wireless in the rooms- service basic at best”
Reviews.Author: Malindaandjon
Reviews.Content: Rooms have a lovely subdued elegance, and the hotel itself is beautiful. But no champagne glasses on new years eve, seriously, nor wireless in the rooms? I know this was an old monastery but would be nice to have hot showers in the mornings and a less cool reception. Restaurant recommendations? A shrug and the receptionist pointed down the road. 'there are plenty down there, go have a look.' um ok. 4 star, 300 euros a night, and a country with such high youth unemployment youd think they could do better. Note that one of the receptionists was more helpful than the youngest girl there, and the older gentleman at the bar was lovely. But mostly the service is disinterested and inadequate for 4 star. Get some staff who know the areas good restaurants and bars. Breakfast is good on the upside.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: Getgerald
Reviews.Content: Staid here from Dec 12 - 15, 2011 This Place is just beautiful. Nicely located in Trastevere next to the Antica Pesa (overrated). It is an old convent and you could still Sense this atmosphere when you walk the premises. Ancient wooden doors, sculptures, the friendly remaining nuns who greet you friendly when they walk in the Garden or on their Way to the church which is next to the reception. You can feel it when you enjoy the rich breakfast buffet in this hall with 5 metres high ceilings and dominated by marvellous paintings. Service is friendly and helpful. The rooms are not the modern Standard but the bed is comfortable, a very nice shower and flat screen TV. Please install WIFI in your rooms !

Reviews.Title: “stay away from this hotel,whatever you do!!!”
Reviews.Author: tynisha k
Reviews.Content: dont let trip advisor fool you into this hotel, just because of the rating i travel alot around the world and stayed in many hotels,usually 4 0r 5 star, and this hotel is the worst place ive stayed in. sure it looks beautiful,sure its a great location but its a noisy hotel,opposite from relaxing,the hallway floor from the outside of your hotel room is tiled which you can hear every foot step since they were too cheap to put a small separation from the entrance of your room. The maids would make loud noises in the morning cleaning so you have no choice but to wake up even if your tired. there is no concierge,worst service ever and they charge you an accomodation fee but for what???? who does that? worst hotel ever and you charge me 18 euros at the end,what a joke. the hotel was clean though so thats pretty much the only thing that was positive.Next time i go to rome,i will pay the extra money to stay at the st regis,This hotel is a fake and not relaxing at all.ps i forgot to mention the noise from the street is super annoying,especially when they like to speed.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and uninviting”
Reviews.Author: traveldiary123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, on arrival we were ignored for a while as the front desk is definitely not that of a 4 star, no concierge, no welcome smile etc. We were shocked when we saw the room which was underground, poky with a view of a bare courtyard. While checking out nobody asked us if we enjoyed our stay. No free internet in room. On the last night there was a loud party which made sleeping difficult. The staff at the buffet breakfast was disinterested except for one. I wonder how this hotel has four star ratings because at four star rates one does have basic expectations, except for the location which is beautiful and the charm the hotel has of being a former monastery there is absolutely no warmth or any comforts to speak of. Guess the rating on TA have made them stop putting in any further efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in an old monastery with friendly and competent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Travel-dud
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel to stay in Trastevere, would recommend it to all. Beautiful old monastery, newly renovated rooms and fabulous breakfast room. Wifi in room (not only in shared areas) would make it even more fantastc.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in my Italian travels!”
Reviews.Author: ariadne1023
Reviews.Content: Thank you trip advisors for bringing me to this hotel! The location was great...secluded on a hill in an interesting neighborhood of restaurants, locals, and shops yet a brief walk over the bridge to the center of Rome. The rooms were spacious and clean...great bathroom and the building maintains the feel; high ceilings and stonework, etc. of the former monestary that it was. Nice breakfast and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “The opposite of "relaxing"”
Reviews.Author: niente
Reviews.Content: This hotel's website says that the hotel is "relaxing," and many TA reviews comment that the rooms are quiet, at least those that face the inner courtyard. Based on that information, we booked (and prepaid) for a room facing the inner courtyard. During our stay, the hotel hosted a large party for more than 100 in the inner courtyard. The party featured a very loud DJ and a lot of screaming, cheering, etc. The noise in our room from the party was so loud that it exceeded the top volume of the room's TV. The party continued until 2:00 a.m. After the party, the hotel staff cleared tables, dishes, etc. which, while not as loud as the party, was not exactly "relaxing." I complained twice to the front desk (at 1:00 a.m. and 1:30 a.m.), and I was told that nothing could be done for me. (However, when I told the man at the front desk that it would be easier to sleep at Termini, the main rail station in Rome, he nodded in agreement.) When I checked out the next morning, other guests were complaining about the noise from party. Because I was literally unable to sleep at the hotel, I asked for a refund or a partial refund of the $450 I paid for the room. My request was refused. Because of the configuration of the hotel, its use as a late night party venue is totally inconsistent with its use as a "relaxing" place to sleep. By the way, the front desk of the hotel displays a plaque touting its rating on TA. I guess once you have enough good reviews, you don't have to care about your guests any more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: srtpdx
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Donna Camilla Savelli has it all: a gorgeous property in a fantastic neighborhood, a great roof deck, very nice rooms, and amazing service. The hotel is a short walking distance to so many great bars and restaurants, you'll find it hard to leave the area. The staff was amazing as well. Everyone we came in contact with was super friendly. Like putzes, we accidentally left our passports, iPod, and a wad of cash in the hotel room safe before we headed out for 5 days in Tuscany. About a day after we left, we realized what we had done and contacted the hotel. They retrieved the lost items and kept them in their safe until we were able to get back to the hotel to pick them up. After our stay in Tuscany, we stayed one more night in Rome in a different hotel before we flew out to experience another neighborhood. We were so sad not to have booked another night in this hotel. We will most DEFINITELY be back.

Reviews.Title: “simple excellence”
Reviews.Author: GoldfishEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: Before we even reached the front door, a solicitous porter had appeared and taken over the cases we'd been struggling with. This set the tone of our delightful stay. The staff were all well trained which showed in their quiet frendliness and thoughful help - excellent service. The breadfst buffet was comprehensive with nothing dried out or less than totally fresh. The room was comfortable, clean and attractive, likewise the bathroom. We thoroughly enjoyed the little extras - like a bedtime sweet. The hotel has been converted from a former convent and an air of unhurried tranquility still remains under the elegant but simple redesign with a few historic gems like the courtyard garden, restored to the 1869 design, and the wooden panelled refectory. The lack of noise between floors and rooms, however, points to efficient C21st soundproofing. Trastavere was a very good base, not just for exploring the tourist attractions but also as a friendly area to wander around and to eat in.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet haven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Norman1932
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for us as part of a package by Reader Offers and was the best of the bunch. The only problem , and that was not the fault of the hotel, was that the driver did not know where the hotel was and neither did the courier. The hotel is on Via Garibaldi just a short walk up from Ponte Sisto. We were on B&B and had a fantastic meal just down Via Garibaldi on the right hand side. The hotel is quiet and peaceful. Our room was 119. It was fitted out with luxury fittings and drapes. The linen was good. Our room had a very heavy grill over the window, which did not bother us but made you wonder what it`s original purpose was as it was obviously designed to keep people in not out. It was,I understand, a monastery. All the staff were real professionals, from the way they walked to the way they dressed. We were very impressed. The Wi Fi was free and it worked. I would take issue with a previous comment that you can walk to the Vatican in ten minutes. We do a lot of walking and it took us over thirty. The weather was hot and we ate in the garden which was peaceful. The food was good.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkKatie_suffolk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Donna Camilla after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. we couldnt have found a better hotel to stay, walking distance to all the main sites and a lovely place of peace and harmony to come back to after a tiring days sightseeing. The full breakfast buffet was great with a varied selection of meats, cheeses, egg bacon sausage, breads, pastries and cakes. and a nice start to the day sitting in the gardens. The hotel is spotlessly clean. we stayed in a standard room no 313 it had no view to speak of but a terrace, a comfortable large bed and a lovely bathroom with big bath, shower etc. The staff were all very helpful and proffessional. especially the reception staff who go out of their way to help. service was excellent. the view from the roof terrace is amazing, you can see the whole of rome, its a shame that the hotel doesnt make more use of it by putting relaxing chairs, and day beds up there for guests to use, but thats the only thing i can think of which would improve the hotel. I would deffinately recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Calm and elegance in Trastavere”
Reviews.Author: MD_Melb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Donna Camilla Savelli is located in an old convent (17th century) in the Trastavere region of Rome. The building itself was designed by Francesco Borromini so you feel like your staying in a special place before you consider the service and accommodation. The inside has lots of Boroque detail and marble flooring. You get a feeling of luxury and space when you walk in from the hot Roman streets. It’s easy to drive past because it is behind some high walls but this affords the hotel a bit of peace and quiet from the streets outside. If you’ve been to Rome before and seen some of the main tourist sites already then this would be the place I’d recommend to stay. However if it’s your first visit, I’d suggest to stay somewhere closer to the ‘action’ ... like somewhere near the Pantheon. Not because of the hotel, but because of it’s location. Staying in Trastavere means you have to either walk a fair way to the main sites ... or work out the transport system (which is easy to do but takes a bit of effort). Trastavere is definitely lively with lots of great restaurants and activity in the evening so if that’s what you’re into this is a good hotel to stay in. The reception was a little disorganised when we arrived, mainly because they were busy when we first arrived (in the morning), but they organised for us to leave our luggage at the hotel and we came back to check in around midday. The reception area was far more organised at that time and someone was then able to show us to our room and then brought up our bags for us. The room had the air conditioning running so when we opened the door ... it was instant relief from the heat (after walking around Trastavere for a few hours prior to checking in). (It was really hot in Rome that day.) The hotel staff all wore very smart uniforms which was a nice touch. I also recall the ladies all wore stockings (when it was so hot)! Poor things! The rooms were smallish (but what you’d expect in Rome unless you're paying a fortune). Despite their size, the rooms have a feeling of elegance and I love the French doors that open out onto the courtyard. (We were on the second floor.) We came home after experiencing a great night out at one of the many restaurants of Trastavere to find that there was a wedding being conducted in the courtyard. We had a flight to catch the next morning so this concerned us. However with the French doors closed, we really didn't hear anything (amazingly). The bathroom is very stylish and the shower head enormous! After the hot days in Rome, the shower was perfect to refresh yourself. They had a good TV (which we could work and watched some programs briefly in English! yeh!!!) We finally got to understand what was happening in the Tour de France which we were interested in (and couldn't quite fathom in Italian)! The terrace roof top was beautiful to check out the roof tops of Rome and gives you a 360 degree view of the area. We were lucky enough because it was summer to have our breakfast in the garden. This was simply beautiful and we felt very special. The gardens are lovely and it is nice to have such a nice space to start the day in busy Rome. The breakfast on offer could not be faulted. There was everything you could want and excellent coffee. The service was always attentive. All in all we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it (and hopefully stay there again).

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love the Donna.. see you next year!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent three nights in Trastevere just on the outskirts of Rome in August this year. From the second we arrived, Hotel Donna Camilla really felt like our home away from home which was all we could ask for. Despite being peak season, we booked using booking.com and found the 'no cancellation rates' to be less than half the rack rate listed on the actual hotel website. The staff, room, grounds and food were all fantastic. The breakfast buffet was the best I have experienced with a selection of gourmet cereals, fresh cut fruit, cheeses, breads, cold meats, eggs cooked to order, salad, juices and a stunning variety of cakes & pastries all made fresh each day. Coffee wasn't the budget percolated either it was made to order by the waiters and was superb. Breakfast each morning in the courtyard was simply the best way to start one's day. The staff were very helpful with local restaurants and general directions, the room was so very quiet and clean. Put simply, I will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming but missing a few amenities”
Reviews.Author: Artemus_Gordon
Reviews.Content: Everything you read about this hotel in other reviews is true. It is very elegant and gracious housed in a former convent. Stone tile floors, a courtyard, and stucco walls were vaguely reminiscent of Latin America but with muted colors. Staff was conscientious and attentive. The courtyard really is pleasant and relaxing. Breakfast was excellent. However, it did have all the quirky Euro hotel amenity misses. No iron, no coffee in room (OK I understand why not in Italy), the half shower door that always leaves you with wet floors, no alarm clock, the 5 lb. keys you must check when you leave, only 5 hangars in the closet (but very nice carved wood), no facial tissue, dim room lighting, and no hair dryer. They claim I had a mini bar but sure didn't see it. The internet worked well and was reasonably snappy, often a problem in Europe. Decent size rooms. This is a "let me tell you about the really neat hotel I stayed at" (it is) but could use a few practical business traveler touches.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: Desireeo
Reviews.Content: This hotel, staff and service were above our expectations! Perfect location, just a few streets away from heart of bohemian Trastevere. The hotel by itself is beautiful, the rooms are lovely, quiet and elegant. The staff professional and attentive. The view from the rooftop is amazing. The breakfast well assorted and tables set in a lovely courtyard. This is a hotel to go back to!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet retreat near the centre of this bustling city”
Reviews.Author: Christina_and_Jon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights during our first visit to Rome on the recommendation of Trpadvisor's downloadable guide to Rome, which described it as a 'Hidden Gem'. Rome is an expensive city and we thought the price of our basic room (£122.50 per night) was fair, although we had hoped for a room with more character. The hotel has an old fashioned atmosphere and some of the staff seem a touch aloof. However, the breakfast staff could not be more helpful and friendly. We were a little disappointed to discover that the hotel did not serve dinner as other restaurants locally did not offer the refinement you would expect in a major city. The breakfast buffet is generous and the courtyard setting lovely. Be warned that if you order black coffee, you will receive instant coffee so you need to request espresso lungho. The location of this hotel is great. Close enough to the lively restaurant and bar areas in Trastevere but just far enough away from the noise. Overall, we enjoyed a comfortable and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great in the summer”
Reviews.Author: Dottorepietro
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August. There were few guests. As the hotel clearly does cater for groups and seminars I would be careful at busier times. This being said, our experience was excellent. The rooms are well described in other reviews. Absolutely fine for the price and hotel rating The building being a former monastery and retaining some period features has great charm. The interior garden is simply wonderful, both as a view from the room and as a location for breakfast. The location is trastevere is in my view perfect. The hotel is quiet, but within a few hundred yards of lively nightlife and also a good base for most of Rome s sights.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of tranquility near the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mrschelt
Reviews.Content: A family of five including disabled grandmother and everything was made easy for us. The pergola covered courtyard was cool and calm to return to after the bustle of Rome. The rooms were high ceilinged and beautiful, the breakfast delicious and restaurants close by and atmospheric. The staff could not have been more helpful and the centre of Rome was a 20 minute walk for most of us and an easy taxi ride for those who could not walk. It was an old convent and there are still 3 nuns living there My favourite hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent price, nice place.”
Reviews.Author: ejm3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in July 2011 while in Italy on business. I prefer to stay in Trastevere when I stay in Rome. It's a little bit of a walk to some of the sights and the train station but at night it's THE place to be with plenty of very good reasonably priced restaurants close by. Also on a Saturday night it's full of people and lots to do. The good part is this hotel is actualy in a quiet part of Trastevere. As others have noted it's in an old monastery building which I guess is cool but depending upon where in the hotel you stay it can be tricky to find your room. I paid 185 Euro a night on a weekend in July which considering location and time of year was a decent deal for the pretty good sized room I had. The place feels like it should cost more. Breakfast was good but not outstanding. Wifi is free but only available in the lobby area. It was arguably the best wifi I had in all of Italy however. Rooms were large by European standards and room & bathroom was very clean. Staff was generally helpful. Only really downside was that it felt a bit 'stuffy'. Not stuffy as in snooty but just kind of quiet. In other words it still felt kind of like a monastery, with several nuns walking around just to complete the effect. This wasn't a big deal but if you're a guy traveling with a bunch of buddies in Rome for a week of drinking and debauchery this might not the the place for you. I have stayed in other similarly priced hotels in Trastevere and I consider this one as good as any and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Historical place”
Reviews.Author: MagusRU
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 5 nights on business. It is located a bit far from the city center (20 min walk). The building is very historical and previously was monastery. The reception was not that welcoming and responsive as it was expected. The breakfast is quite good but the service is slow – the same for lunch. Wifi costs 5 EUR per hour and works only in the lobby near the bar (nice way to make some extra penny). Try to work on your singing skills. When you are taking shower and sing in the bathroom and somebody from the service without even knocking comes to your room you are not embraced :-) Seems to be overpriced for what you are getting. If you want to explore Rome by walking probably you need to select more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, grace, off the beaten path and a pretty decent value.”
Reviews.Author: BertrandofYork
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood called Trastevere is still in the middle of Rome's action, but it's also just slightly removed. It's a little more neighborhood-y and a bit less tourist-y. Read about this hotel on Trip Advisor and stayed here while on business in early July 2011. Since I was in Rome for 2 weeks, I decided to mix things up. Stayed near Via Veneto one week and shifted over to Trastevere for the 2nd. (Stayed at Rose Garden Palace the first week. Had also picked it based on very good TripAdvisor reviews, and found those reviews to accurate.) Donna Camilla is a comfortable, gracious, charming place; a modern hotel wrapped within the walls of one-time convent. Check out their website, which has handsome photos and will give you an immediate sense of what the place is like. It's very clean, the staff is abundant and helpful, the quiet courtyard is a delight for an outdoor breakfast. Stayed in one of the smaller singles facing the walled driveway. It was a Saturday night and therefore a bit more traffic-y on the roads than usual, perhaps. The buzz of scooters heading up to the way top of Via Garibaldi where there's a great city view and outdoor bars. The next morning, decided to upgrade to an "Executive Room". Larger, quieter, faced the inner (breakfast) courtyard. A/C was abundant (this was Rome in July -- a bit toast-y though better than, say, New York City's muggy summer swelter). I was there with a bunch of colleagues and we walked to some memorable restaurants in the area. One was Taverna Trilusi, evidently a popular spot with Rome's soccer stars. A longer walk (or a short cab ride) is a Trastevere must: Roma Sparita, where Anthony Bourdain did his episode on the quintessential Roman pasta dish Caccio e Pepe (sp?). That is an amazing pasta, and everyone I was with (a bunch of not so easily impressed New Yorkers) loved their meal. Back to Camilla: only drawbacks -- no wireless in rooms (plug); they say that their thick stony walls make wifi ineffective. For wifi, you need to sit downstairs in the lounge area. I cannot think of another negative. Oh, yes: internet is not free. But overall, thought this was a really good value, would stay here again in a heartbeat for business or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “EXcellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngieVGirl
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel now for three visits and I am now going again for the fourth time. (I will keep you posted) I have been to Italy many many times over the years and I must say they are so many beautiful things to see and do. But if you happen to want to be in an area where you can walk anytime of day or night and if you want to have old Italy this is the place for you. It has been changed from a Monastary to a Hotel in recent years, what a beautiful building. The hotel has a wonderful breakfast and great service, they want you to be happy, what more can you ask? If you want to be in an area that is quite this is the place for you. Dont forget to go to the roof top to see all of Rome and its glory.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in trendy area”
Reviews.Author: valtrav
Reviews.Content: had a 3 night stay here in June, arrived somewhat tired after 2 flights, not promising start, the lady on reception was extremely abrupt and rude as if checking us in was a great inconvenience to her, never a smile cracked her face - apologies as never caught her name and she wasn't there for the rest of our stay otherwise would have commented to the manager about her demeanour. After that was extremely worried that the whole experience was going to go downhill but i was very wrong. A very helpful bellboy took our luggage and escorted us whilst chatting about all the facilities in the hotel and nearby. The rest of the staff were impeccable, very friendly and couldn't do enough for you. We had a standard room but was good size and with a wonderful deep bath. Yes limited TV channels but you're not in Rome to watch TV! The buffet breakfast is again wonderful with a great choice and beautiful location in the courtyard garden. Trastevere itself is buzzing particularly at night with a wide choice of restaurants, we tried Romolo just down the hill from the hotel and would recommend. It was easy to walk anywhere from here, up to the vatican or across the river to the forum or up to piazza navona area, would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charm in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: hg6649
Reviews.Content: We checked in at Hotel Donna Camilla Savelli for two nights in June of 2011. We chose the hotel based on a review in the Travel section of the NY Times, as well advice of friends who travel to Rome frequently. We were not disappointed. The hotel is absolutely charming. We had a lovely room overlooking the beautiful courtyard. A renovated convent, the hotel's decor is simple and tasteful with nice touches of luxury. Stone walls and floors with beamed ceilings, high thread count linens, fluffy towels, robes, slippers, flat screen TVs, nightly turn-down service -- we were extremely comfortable and even a little pampered. Yes, the rooms are not large, but hotel rooms in most major cities are usually small. If you want a giant room, pay for a suite or spend your next vacation in Omaha. The continental breakfast was one of the best I've had in Italy. In addition to the traditional breads, pastries, cheeses and fruit, they also had bacon, eggs, and sausages. The pastries, in particular, were delightful. The staff was very charming and provided excellent restaurant recommendations, arranged car service for us, and met our every request. My one negative: no free WiFi or internet access in our room -- in this day and age, that's just simply unacceptable. Why hotels continue to charge guests for this very basic service is beyond me. In fact, most value-priced hotels offer free WiFi; It's insane to be charged 12 Euros a day for internet access. The only unfortunate experience during our stay was that we witnessed two different incidents where irate guests were berating the desk staff. The first was a gentleman who was clearly deeply disturbed and got "all in up" in the face of the desk person in charge, wagging a pen very close to the clerks eyes and shouting at him. The desk clerk remained very calm and polite, and handled the situation very well. The other incident involved another guest who had been given directions to a restaurant by the desk clerk only to arrive there and find it closed. By the time this guest returned to the hotel, the clerk was at dinner. The guest insisted the clerk return to the desk and apologize to him in person. Seriously? I don't know if either of these events were signs that something wasn't right with the service at the hotel (our service experience was outstanding) or that people are just plain crazy and arrogant. They reminded of us that we are all human, and even on vacation mistakes happen. And there is no excuse for being a jerk. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in lovely location”
Reviews.Author: ant68
Reviews.Content: We found this a lovely hotel away from the city centre, but only a 10 to 20 minute walk to every sight in the city. The feeling at the hotel is one of relaxation, the staff are very helpful (especially the waiters and bar staff). The rooftop is stunning, but very under-used, we asked for chairs on a daily basis to be put up and that was done within minutes. It’s not really for me to justify other people’s criticisms, but here goes on a few that seem to crop up; room size - well it’s a converted monastery..... Not too sure if it would have been appropriate for the nuns to live the life of luxury. The smallish room we stayed in had been extended into the corridor, whilst maintaining the natural roof timbers. It was a compromise worth making to experience the ambiance of the original building. Rudeness - the front staff were the most abrupt out of all the staff. I would not call them rude, after frequenting many Italian venues it is more the "Rome" way, and they were polite and efficient, just not chatty! If you want a mixture of atmosphere, luxury, tradition and peace, but still be close to the heart of the action then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: legs77
Reviews.Content: A lovely lovely stay at Donna Camilla Savelli. We arrived at 2am after a stressful journey and the welcome was lovely and check in swift so we could get some much needed rest. The room was a tad on the small size for the price i paid but it wasn't too bad. The maids came in at least twice a day and made beds, replaced towels and cleaned. Breakfast was awesome and the whole place had such a relaxing vibe. What a shame it doesn't have a rooftop restaurant. A lovely lovely place to visit, i'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vered_10
Reviews.Content: not enough words to express how much we enjoyed stayng at this hotel. we arrived at around 10 p.m. and althogh told that room will be ready at noon we we're asked to wait at the lovely court yard and with in 15 minutes, were told room is ready. in meantime we asked for a cup of capuccino, and were granted with complimentary cake tray all of best quality. room was huge ( to accomodte all 5 of us wonderfully) a woman standing at reception( later learned she was hotel mannager) asked if all our needs have been complited to our setisfection... a girl named simona was both very polite at internet comunication and in person. the room provided the best of everything: comfortable beds amazing bed sheets ( best in itally) uniqe slippers, and wardrobes for all. breakfast- wonderfull/ surrounding- super. we would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for the size of the room”
Reviews.Author: jarlbertil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and very nice but the superior room is very small. The standard is supposed to be even smaller. The location is marvellous and so was our stay but I was surprised with the size of the bed and bathroom for the price and name (superior)

Reviews.Title: “True magic in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: lilaloTLV
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Located in the heart of beautiful Tratevere, this hotel is really a special one. It has this special peaceful atmosphere that makes the vacation special. Our room was never nice, with excellent bed, and beautiful bathroom, with all the necessary amnaties. The service was great, and the breakfast was the best we ever had in Europe!. The garden is so beautiful & peaceful, and the fact that you see the nuns walking by…just helps the magic. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “breathtaking place to stay and a fantastic neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: echojuliet
Reviews.Content: Donna Camilla Savelli is an absolutely beautiful hotel. Grand yet simple, you feel the sense of history from the minute you cross the threshold. Situated in the buzzy, atmospheric neighbourhood of Trastevere you have some of the best bars and restaurants in Rome on your doorstep. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff who are all excellent. Breakfast is delicious and plentiful. The courtyard garden and rooftop terrace are peaceful outdoor spaces to unwind after pounding the streets of Rome - all of the sites are easily walkable from the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel and it really was the perfect place to stay for a special weekend away. We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel, Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Deano23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel from March 5th-9th 2011 in room number 605. The room was abit small but still comfortable and when you're in Rome you want to be out looking at the sights not sitting in the room, not unless you are ill of course ! The Hotel is very clean and there is a lovely courtyard and also great views of Rome from the terrace. Also the area of Trastevere is very nice, very vibrant. I must say a big thank you to the staff there, they was always very very helpful, ie with directions and even a bottle of wine long after the bar had closed. Nothing was too much of a problem for them, excellent service. All the great sights are within walking distance of the hotel, just make sure you wear a comfortable pair of shoes/trainers and mind the cobbles ! All in all, Rome is a wonderful place to visit and this hotel added to the Charm of the holiday. Would 100% go back to Rome and this hotel. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Romantic, Clean, Friendly Hotel. Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laithalhash Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We were recommended the hotel from a friend who knows Rome very well and we were not let down. The room was perfect, the bed was like a cloud to sleep on. The hotel was immaculate and the breakfast was brilliant. If you want to enjoy a nice, relaxing holiday then this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: vibekeml
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights (Feb 28 - Mar 4) at this little jewel in the heart of Rome/Trastevere district. The hotel is an originally convent however now renovated and turned in to a hotel. It seems like a few sisters are still living on the premises as they were observed every morning during breakfast. The Classic room was cozy but a little tiny for a longer stay – but very positive that the room was cleaned twice a day. Bathroom was of a good size however I had problems with hot water 2 of the mornings. Would recommend the hotel to upgrade the secure box to fit a laptop and provide free Internet access. The roof terrace had an amazing view over Rome – best I have ever seen! Need also to mention the breakfast with the good selection – including fresh fruits. Staff was very friendly and actually remembered my room number every time I left or picked up the key. This is definitely a hotel for future Rome visits – both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful converted 17thC convent in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: ultimate5
Reviews.Content: We got lucky and got exactly what we had hoped for and a little more. It's a great place, tranquil, peaceful, monastic. Great period pieces, Borromini designed chapel, it felt private. The reception staff were really helpful, they recommended some great local restaurants all in walking distance and even arranged for us to eat opposite the Pantheon! Everything is in walking distance for the able bodied and not too old, we just wandered from one Roman ruin, church or landmark every minute of every day. The Vatican is within 20 minutes walking or within a short and inexpensive taxi ride. For our first visit to Rome this was a great experience, and place to stay - we very much enjoyed Marco G's across the road for some great food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent **** Rome Hotel: walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: DRouatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7-nights over New Years. It is in the Trastevere district on the west side of the Tiber south of the Vatican. The hotel is a fully restored 16th century monastery now with 70+ rooms all tastely renovated. The hotel is on 4 floors. Beautiful decor - see photos. Excellent breakfast room (appears to have been a monastery meeting room in the past) and hot and cold breakfast - which unfortunately never changed. Very attentive staff. Our room was mid-sized (we booked an internet promotion) with a well appointed bathroom - but no tub. An upgrade to a more deluxe room would upgrade your experience. The hotel is walking distance to virtually everything including the Vatican, Campo de' Fiori, Piazza Navona, all of old room including the Pantheon, The Coloseum, The Jewish Ghetto, etc. We walked every where. Several suggestions: you need to book a Vatican Tour in advance in order to skip lines and actually see anything. We suggest romancandletours.com who were both affordable and excellent guides. Also the Galleria Borghese which houses a previously private art collection of the Borghese family - probably the most extensive collection of art in private hands REQUIRES AN ADVANCE RESERVATION -DO IT ON THE INTERNET or via a tour group like Roman Candle Tours. Email Matthew at: [--] The Trastevere area the hotel was in is walking distance to 10-20 very good restaurantes: we would recommend Romolo - fabulous food, I mean very good!, The hotel had lots to recommend. Net/net. Godd **** hotel. Loved the Trastevere area (working class area being reno'ed. Real people live here). Excellent restaurants. Walking distance to everything ,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and peaceful”
Reviews.Content: Really comfortable bed, spacious, friendly staff. Lovely breakfast. Stayed here based on recommendation by the NY times. Highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: Boroboy36
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on bed and breakfast basis (Thursday, Friday and Saturday) and found the whole place to be quality. Check in was very quick with the receptionists being very professional, polite and speaking good english. We were shown to our room which was very large with an enormous bed and bespoke marble and granite bathroom. Flat screen tv and all furnishings were of a high quality. Towels were changed twice daily and the bed turned down on a night. The breakfast choice was first class with continental and hot selections. The conversion from a convent to a hotel has been carried out very tastefully in deed, and alot of the original artwork and religious icons have been adopted and used as centrepieces throughout the hotel. All of the staff that we encountered acted in a manor befitting a high quality hotel, and this place is certainly high quality.

Reviews.Title: “You are not wellcome!”
Reviews.Author: LESLIONS
Reviews.Content: The staff is impolite,unfriendly! Room are very small and are not cleaned twice a day as it is said in some review. That is to say they are not prépared for night No flower no bottle of water what a boaring place! What a sad boaring expensive place to stand in Rome

Reviews.Title: “If you have a choice, stay at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Swish1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donna Camilla Savelli hotel for our honeymoon and we couldn't have asked to stay in a better hotel. The staff were extremely friendly, very helpful and we were made to feel extremely welcome. Despite the fact that we spoke no Italian they had a very good understanding of English and they were more than able to help with with any of our enquiries. The rooms were beautiful with a mix of antique furniture in a clean and minimalist environment. Even though we were staying in one of the cheaper rooms we still had marble floors, beams on the roof and all the mod cons you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Another point of note, as is mentioned in other reviews, is the breakfast. It has everything that you could ever need from a breakfast from cereals and pastries to selections of cured meets and sausages to bacon and eggs. You also have the choice to sit outside in the courtyard to eat it which is great when the weather was as good as it was when we were there. The hotel is located at the top of a small hill which is just outside the main trastevere area. This means that it doesnt get any of the noise of the town area and remains peaceful and tranquil at all hours of the day. It also means that you are on the doorstep of some of the best restaurants in Rome, I suggest La Scala, and not surrounded by the tourist orientated restaurants of the centre. The hotel also has an amazing roof terrace which looks over the skyline of Rome and in my opinion provides one of the best night time panoramas of the city itself. Should you be on the terrace around 12 in the morning you are also in a great position to see the canon fire from hilltops as they set the city to Vatican time. All in all the hotel is great and we will defiantly be returning in the future to enjoy another stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, beautiful location, except for the mean front desk people”
Reviews.Author: GCATravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was gorgeous. My room was beautiful, clean and the hairdryer was the best I have EVER used! You couldn't take long showers because the drain was slow, but the shower itself- wonderful. The breakfast was amazing and the wait staff was so friendly. They helped me practice Italian and even put smiley faces in my cappucino. The location is just beautiful and in the evening you walk outside the hotel and into streets and streets of restaurants and bars. Short walk right over to Piazza Novona and many other sights. I walked everywhere from the hotel except to attractions a bit farther away like the Collesium. Ok so my one complaint: The women at the front desk. One in particular. She was mean, stern and military. I stayed for 3 nights. She was always so serious and I felt uncomfortable to ask for a map, directions, or anything! They were scary! The men at the front desk seemed scared of them too! Another very petite front desk woman did not return my "hello or a "good morning" and looked like a little mean school principal or something. One man who worked late night at the desk was super polite, and because the in-room internet was not working he was very sweet in explaining it all to me. If this hotel gets FRIENDLY and less serious/mean front desk staff, this hotel would be 100% perfect.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: cucurbi
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand why this hotel has the 4 star grade, including the service, hotel staff, and system. (except exterior) Above all, Front desk members are not polite and in a very businnesslike tone. Moreover I ask room cleanliness in every time and restraunt server are also not friendly and courteous. I travelled so many countries and hotel until now, but I have not seen this kind of hotel for several years. It was owful memory for us.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: jessie189
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to Italy. We had the great fortune to stay 5 nights in this unique and lovely hotel that was a 17th century convent designed by the architect Boromini. The building is beautiful, the staff kind and helpful, the room was luxurious and the breakfast was bountiful. After our long days walking through the the city, this elegant hotel was an oasis of serenity. I wish we could keep it a secret!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel ideal for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: andydebstark
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Donna Camilla. We booked the trip to celebrate our wedding anniversary and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a good location particularly if like us you want to explore Rome on foot. The room we stayed although not large was comfortable and clean. The hotel itself though is a real gem with plenty of character. The staff were all friendly and helpful and overall I would recommend it to others and would definitely returnin the future.

Reviews.Title: “Why would one stay anywhere else when in Rome?”
Reviews.Author: Donnico1
Reviews.Content: Donna Camilla Savelli (DCS) is a rather new hotel housed in a rather old building designed by a baroque master in the 1600s. It combines the best aspects of both seamlessly. DCS used to be a convent until recently, and in fact there are still a few sisters that live on the premises. There are high walls surrounding the building that allows the interior to serve as an oasis of calm in the busling city. On the interior, the hotel is tastefully decorated. Marble covers the floors and in certain areas baroque interior design is featured in such a way that we found ourselves taking pictures of the hotel as if it were a museum in its own right. Our room was newly renovated and large for Italy. There was a nice modern sink, bath, and shower. Our room was one of the few to feature a small terrace, and it was pure joy to awake to the sound of Rome`s churchbells though our open terrace doors. DCS has a great breakfast spread and a professional staff, and it has a beautiful interior garden in which to enjoy this breakfast. The garden is also a fine place to retire to in the evening with a bottle of wine after a long day of sightseeing. While DCS has no dinner restaurant of its own, it is located in bustling and authentic Trastevere which features a multitude of reasonably priced eateries. It takes about 15 minutes of walking to reach the Campo dei Fiori or the Colosseum from DCS, but it is certainly closer to the historic city center than all of the high priced/low charactered hotels by the Piazza Spagna. In short, we really enjoyed DCS and would love to return one day. It is a unique hotel in Rome`s most vibrant neighborhood, and I highly reccommend it. P.S.- for all those art/history buffs, Bramante`s famous Tempietto is literally just around the corner from DCS, tucked away in a Spanish church.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel - calm relaxed atmosphere and great place to be!”
Reviews.Author: -OKMrEd-
Reviews.Content: My young lady and I spent 3 nights in this hotel based solely on the feedback on Tripadvisor. Believe all the good things you read - service is A1, rooms perfect, bed large and good firmness and breakfast is so extensive you can go with out lunch! My opinion - go there!

Reviews.Title: “Just so pretty I will never forget it”
Reviews.Author: chacheme
Reviews.Content: I have been to many hotels but this is so pretty and so memorable. The staff did anything and everything to please it is a small hotel but unforgetable; that we were there july 21 2010 for three days and came back again at the end of our vaction, will do it again,

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: LKD80
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff and position. Only complaint that there was not a computer you could use to just check your emails, instead having to pay the 10 Euro to logg on in your room. Otherwise WIFI quite reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the heart of Rome !”
Reviews.Author: surrey-GU
Reviews.Content: Arriving in the city via a pre-arranged private transfer from the airport we were treated to stunning view of Rome from the heights of the Via Garibaldi. We then stopped in the heat of the early afternoon outside of this delightful former seventeenth century convent and looked admiringly at the welcoming Borromini designed facade. Upon entering the hotel we were warmly greeted by Emanuella and her colleague who directed us to our comfortable rooms, our the luggage was quickly conveyed to our temporary home. This jewel of a hotel is a short walk from the major tourist attractions of which we visited the Vatican; Colosseum; Trevi fountain; Pantheon; Forum and even had time to add a little retail therapy for the female contingent of our family in our short stay. After our days spent strolling and sampling the delights of the gelataria; a fine example of which is just accross the Ponte Sisto bridge, we returned to the cool, quiet environment of the hotel to freshen up and head out to sample the superb wine and cuisine readily available within a short walk in the Trastevere area. If you are a fish lover as are we then the excellent Antica Pesa is only metres away down the via Garibaldi and even better has a marvellous choice of superb Sicillian wines and to finish off a tempting choice of eighteen desserts. This dining spot is frequented mainly by locals and the understated entrance belies the quaintly decorated tardis like interior. Comfortably replete we retire to our hotel for a cool quiet nights sleep and then refreshed wake up and make our way down to sample the superb and ample choice of breakfast fare which we enjoy out in the main cloister garden. I think it is obvious from all I have said that I would confidently recommend this hotel to anyone wanting the benefits of a stylish location; eager and helpful staff; cool comfortable rooms and a great quiet nights sleep, all of which is within easy walking distance of the sights, sounds and eateries of the city. A rarity for us I am certain if and when we make a return visit to Rome, probably without our teenagers by then, we would have no hesitation in taking up residence again at the Donna Camilla Savelli.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, an Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: Sophia56
Reviews.Content: We used thisTrastevere hotel for four nights as a base for our explorations of Rome returning each night to eat dinner at one of the restaurants. The hotel is an oasis of calm away from the frenzied tourist areas, but Trastevere can be quite lively in the evenings so one doesn't become bored. One can read about the history of Trastevere, one of the oldest Roman communities, the history and architecture of the hotel, look at photos,amenities offered by the hotel elsewhere on the internet, so I won't go into great detail. It is a hidden gem, a former nun's convent, renovated with modern facilities now managed by a professional hotel management outfit. Three of the retired nuns still live in their own designated quarters and take strolls on the premises. We looked forward to the excellent, buffet breakfasts which we ate at the small patio tables in the open, garden courtyard. The food offered included an assortment of breads, cheeses, fruits, juices, cold meats, delicious pasteries, hot scrambled eggs with bacon or sausages, yoghurts, regular coffee, capuccino coffee upon request, etc. We had a fun time eating our breakfasts here. The staff was very attentive, efficient and helpful. We upgraded our room from a standard classic to a notch above, which was probably a little more luxurious than a classic standard. Airy, nicely decorated, good shower. Location wise, we didn't find the walking distance to the must sees unreasonable. For example, it took us about 20-25 minutes to walk from St. Peter's Basilica along the Tiber river to Trastevere. We walked to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Forum, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Old and New”
Reviews.Author: cocoloco15
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, quiet, serene setting in old convent, beautiful, modern room. We even had a little private balcony. Roof deck had no furniture on it, guess it wasn't high season yet, but great views of the rooftops of Rome. It seemed a little pricey, but included the most magnificent breakfast spread imaginable. Just down the street is newly opened restaurant called Marco G with fantastic food. It feels like you're out of the city, but all of Trastevere and Rome is convenient by foot, bus or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “This will now be my first choice in hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cheeselover14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming, elegant and well-located hotel for only 1 night. That was a mistake as we found this to be one of the most beautiful, comfortable and convenient hotels in Rome. When we return to Rome, this is the only place I want to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay in advance... we did and got booted to a worse hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sharon6636
Reviews.Content: From the looks of the lobby, this is a lovely hotel in a great location, but I can't say any more about it because despite the fact that we booked our room two months in advance and PAID for it two months in advance, when we arrived we were told that they were overbooked and that they were putting us in another hotel. The only explanation was some convoluted story about their computer system going down, though it was working when we arrived and they had a manual printout of our pre-paid reservation (as did we). They pretended not to be able to speak English as soon as I expressed dismay, though I then heard them speaking good English on the phone a few minutes later. We switched to French and I had to spend a great deal of time and energy getting them to put us up in a decent hotel nearby and refund us the difference in cost between the two hotels. I still doubt we got the real difference in cost because they refunded us the difference between what we paid them and what the other hotel cost on the Internet, and I'm sure that they got a discount on the room, but they would not reveal what they had paid, claiming they did not know what the room was costing them. At first they wanted to put us in hotel Ripa which is rated about 300 places lower than Camilla Savelli on Tripadvisor. When I said I refused to go to another hotel until we could use their computer and read about it on Tripadvisor, they shifted to saying "oh no, we aren't putting you in Ripa, we're putting you in Trilussa Palace." We looked that up to find the rating (about 20 places beneath Savelli) and check the prices. The location is not nearly as nice as Savelli; it's on the main drag and quite far from the part of Trastevere where all the restaurants are. The manager apologized profusely and drove us to the hotel herself, but we are terribly disappointed that we are not staying in the special place we researched and booked in advance, and for no apparent reason. It also seems quite dishonest to be told on arrival that no room is available when we paid for it months ago and plenty of other guests were able to stay in the hotel. I'm not sure why this happened to us and not other guests; we arrived on the late side *6 pm* and are two women traveling together; or maybe there really was a computer glitch. Bottom line: don't pay in advance and email the day before to make sure they still have your room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ex-monastery hotel with lovely service and inner courtyard”
Reviews.Author: MirellaBudapest
Reviews.Content: Beautifully restored old monastery, staff is extremely helpful, giving us good suggestions where to go out. Room is spacious and luxurious, very tasty and refined architecture with stunning view to Rome. Breakfast is delicious. Definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “handsome and quiet”
Reviews.Author: scorbutico
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two weeks. The public rooms are austerely elegant. The bedrooms are small with one window overlooking a refined courtyard.Full breakfast included in the daily rate is buffet style and of good quality. Street noise is almost completely absent. TV and internet are overpriced extras at 39 Euros a day. The staff is pleasant and cooperative but poorly informed about public transportation. (Rome's bus system is complex) The hotel is very close to many good restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful slice of history with all the modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: yellowponygirl
Reviews.Content: The location alone makes this my new favorite hotel in Rome. Convenient walking distances to nearly everything. Wonderful Trastevere locale close enough to all of the excellent restaurants and hot spots yet on a tranquil side street. Excellent staff, great breakfast. Beautiful restoration of a historical property. An overall splendid choice if this type of thing calls to you as it does me!

Reviews.Title: “Austere accomodations at luxurious prices”
Reviews.Author: Thinfire
Reviews.Content: Although the architecture of this 17th century monastery turned into a luxury hotel is quite impressive, we were disappointed with our accomodations. The 'larger' executive rooms barely fit a double bed and the bathrooms are just as spartan. I guess this reflects the spirit of poverty and frugality of the original cells' occupants but then one wonders why they keep the prices so sinfully costly. Considering that for the same monies (for example: 350 euro for a double exe and 600 for a suite) there are several more comfortable and less monastic options in the Eternal City, I recommend you think it twice before making a reservation to this exclusive yet pricey convent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Old Convent in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: izzy76
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Hotel Donna Camilla Savelli. Lovely, historic building. Enjoyable breakfast in the garden (included in price).

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: pln61
Reviews.Content: After our work-related meeting at the rather forgettable Sheraton Roma, we had one day on our own in Rome and decided to stay at Hotel Donna Camilla Savelli to be in Trastevere. We were so glad we did; in fact, we are still congratulating ourselves for this decision. The hotel used to be a convent whose original architect was no less than Borromini! The renovation has managed to preserve the beautiful original details while allowing for a harmonious blend of modern conveniences and stylish comforts. Our room was spacious, sparkingly clean, and filled with light; it overlooked the beautiful interior courtyard and even had a view of St. Peter's in the distance! The AC worked beautifully and hummed quietly. The breakfast buffet was abundant in both quantity and variety and was very elegantly and brightly presented. Even more impressive are the public spaces: exquisite tiled corridors with arcaded spaces running in parallel where fauteuils are discreetly placed with magazines and daily newspapers for guests' use; ancient wide staircases with marble steps --but there are also lifts if one is so inclined! Gorgeous ancient water fountains and wall sculptures turning up in unexpected corners. As previous TA posts have noted, there is such a sense of tranquility at Hotel Donna Camillla Savelli, due in no small part to the 2 courtyards, one right after one leaves Via Garibaldi behind but before the reception office, and the other is interior and landscaped where breakfast is served. After a day of sightseeing, the Hotel really is an oasis to which one returns. We were lucky enough to be there at the time of mass and were able to see the magnificent chapel. We weren't just staying at a hotel; we were staying amidst the architectural splendor of baroque Rome! Service was absolutely top notch: quietly solicitous and helpful; straightforward restaurant recommendations and directions; reliable taxi reservations at very good and honest/uninflated rates (45 Euros to Fiumicino for 2 passengers). The location was perfect for us who wanted something on the quiet side. We ourselves like to walk everywhere, but for first-time visitors to Rome who may want to see the major sites at Piazza Navonna, the Coliseum, etc., it may be worth looking into bus or metro routes. Close to the Hotel are some fabulous restaurants: Antica Pesa is literally 20 steps away; Da I 2 Ciccioni is right behind the hotel, if one is after the trattoria experience; Antico Arco is a slightly longer walk up the hill. We opted for the newly opened Ristorante Minnetti which is just across the street and which is actually run by the daughter of Roberto Minnetti, himself behind the famous Ristorante Di Poggio Antico in Montalcino. In fact, the chef at Minnetti himself had come from Poggio Antico. All that we can say about our absolutely fabulous dinners at Minnetti is that we are now planning a trip to Poggio Antico in the near future! (And the service at Minnetti is very, very personal and warm, with very thoughtful recommendations and explanations.) In all, Hotel Donna Camilla Savelli is a very special place with an exquisite sense of space and history and with outstanding services. One will not be hounded by intrusive invitations for must-see tours of Rome or pre-arranged airport transfers for 70 Euros, etc.; instead, one will be looked after very warmly and with a refreshing touch of class. This will be our hotel in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Peace and tranquility”
Reviews.Author: foodshooter
Reviews.Content: My wife, child and in laws stayed here for 3 days in September 2008 and we did not want to leave! The hotel is exceptional. It does not have all the trappings of 'chain hotels' and in many ways made it better. It is located in a very beautiful converted convent. Although not in the 'centre' of Rome it is still close enough to walk to many places. There are some very pretty squares within 5 minutes that seem to be very unchanged with a lot of people watching going on from the restaurants. Back to the hotel, it is an oasis of calm in an otherwise very bustling city. The rooms we had were very tasteful, and they certainly went to great lengths to retain a lot of the character of the building. The hotel is built on 3 sides around a lovely courtyard, that is a very pleasant place to sit with a glass of wine. The staff were exceptionally discreet yet friendly and very keen to help if we had any requests. The hotel did not appear to have a full restaurant when I stayed, but you could order some 'bar' food. It did however serve an amazing breakfast buffet and with so many good restaurants in the vicinity I was not disappointed to venture out of the hotel to eat in the evenings. I would definitely stay here again the next time I'm in Rome and in fact this hotel was so good I would go to Rome specifically for this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Filopat
Reviews.Content: I and my wife visited Rome for the first time, so we did not know excatly what to expect. The whole stay was wonderful, I can recommend Rome for everybody. Party that is because of the city itself (beautiful city, you can walk from place to place, good food and wine, reasonable prices, good service), and partly because of this lovely hotel. It is in an old monastery in the Travestere. Good location, you can easily walk to Vatican and other sites, and the lively streets and restaurants of Travestere are close. I have travelled a lot and seen more hotels than one really needs, but I have to say that Donna Camilla Savelli is something different: the building is lovely and the service goes beyond the call of duty, especially the front disk service was wonderful. Breakfast was good and plenty. Two minor minuses, which should not scare anyone: 1) we did not have much of a view from the window because the window was quite high on the wall of the quite small room (no one comes to Rome to stay in the hotel room anyway...), 2) we did not see any sign outside suggesting that this is a hotel (luckily we came by taxi, as it was late in the evening). Maybe they just cannot put any hotel signs out there because it is a historical building, I don't know... This may be confusing if you try to find the hotel for the first time, the entry is bit tricky anyway, beware of the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustaWatcher
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at this hotel in October 2008 and loved it. The staff is excellent -- they are attentive, friendly, and courteous at all times. I believe they all speak at least some English. The hotel is located in the Travestere area of Rome. It is conveniently located as long as you don't mind walking 15-20 minutes to the major attractions in Rome such as Vatican City, the Roman Forum and Colosseum and for another 5-10 minutes, the Spanish Steps. The area around Travestere is a little dirty and there is grafetti everywhere (also around the Pantheon and the Colosseum) The Hotel serves a very good buffet breakfast. The only hot food served was scrambled eggs and pancetta (bacon) and some type of sausage. The rest was several cold cereals, numerous pastries, yogurt, various sandwich meats and cheeses, some fruit (whole and cut up) and about 4 different types of breads and toast. They should consider offering more than just scrambled eggs in our opinion as you can get tired of that after 4 days. Since they have a kitchen available to them it would be wonderful if they started offerering sandwiches, etc...during the day for those times when you just don't want to go out. The room size was probably around 15' x 15'. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom is small but was absolutely one of the most beautiful marble bathrooms I've seen. The walk-in shower was terrific -- huge 8" waterfall type showerhead. We had a beauitful window that overlooked the courtyard. You could open the window/shutters which was really nice in order to get the fresh air in as well as hear the many church bells that rang during the day and night. The common areas of the Hotel are magnificant. You can literally "feel" the history of the convent in every stairway and hallway. Absolutely magnificant remodeling/restoration. There is a chapel next to the reception that the nuns use every morning and is available to the guests as well. It looked magnificant as well. I highly recommend this hotel if walking between historical sites is your plan. The only downside to this hotel was its lack of in-house restaurant or cafe. I can't imagine why it would be a big problem for them to get one open and I highly recommend to them that they that to make this hotel absolutely perfect. The rooms are not the same as US five-star quality hotel rooms but the history behind the hotel/convent and the quality of the restoration made up for it in my opinion. If you have any interest in staying in a historical monument, but with nearly all the luxeries of today, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Donna Camilla Savelli is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: gina3ring
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Donna Camilla Savelli Hotel by default when my original hotel was booked out by a medical convention. I was with a group of travellers on a 'Grand tour of Itay and Sicily' and apparently this was the first group booking the hotel had experienced. We had just arrived at the start of our tour in Rome and were all pleasantly surprised at this hotel. The hotel is so serene, the amenities the best, and the staff so ready to please. As an extra bonus I was able to visit the chapel which is located within the hotel, only open for an hour on Sundays, and the nuns still live in a seperate part of the hotel. It was an exquisite experience and a great introduction to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: WDC123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4-night stay at the Hotel Donna Camilla Savelli. The facilities were beautiful and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room had a comfy bed, a very large shower with a bench, and a window with excellent light-blocking shades (great for sleeping in) that opened out into a lovely courtyard. The complimentary breakfast was impressive -- meats, pastries, juices -- more than your average complimentary breakfast. The entire staff was very friendly and attentive. Somehow, everyone (even staff members we hadn't met) knew who we were and what room we were staying in. Our airline lost our luggage, and whenever we encountered a new staff member, that person would update us on our luggage status -- even if we hadn't met that person before! I'm still not sure how they did that. They were also really helpful with the luggage retrieval -- one staff member gave the airline her personal mobile number so she could receive SMS updates for us. Rome is a hot place that requires lots of walking, and I took 2 showers almost every day we were there -- and every time we left our room our towels were refreshed and the room was straightened up. My only complaint about our stay is that it cost extra money for Internet service. I thought it was a little nickel-and-dimey to charge for Internet access when the room cost $400 (USD)/night. However, the staff members did offer to look things up for us on their computers, so again the helpful staff saved the day. Overall, we loved our stay, and if we return to Rome we will definitely return to this hotel!
